Package server

Class CommandHandler<T>

java.lang.Object
server.CommandHandler<T>
Type Parameters:
T - any type
Direct Known Subclasses:
GameServerCommandHandler
public abstract class CommandHandler<T>
extends java.lang.Object
Class for handling the input and output of custom commands to and from the generic object. Implementations are responsible for maintaining specific commands and how they interact with the generics that they so choose. It is up to the user to manage what their own implementations send as a response. It is highly recommended to call the base class's implementation (if one exists) to have a previously defined command take over. Please be aware of the commands that already exist in the class that you are inheriting.
Author:
Collin

  • Constructor Details

    • CommandHandler

      public CommandHandler()
      Constructor. Useful when not wanting to bind to a server right away, or to grab all the commands without needing a server.

    • CommandHandler

      public CommandHandler​(T server)
      Constructor. Takes in an object worth of command handling.
      Parameters:
      server - an object that is implementation defined

  • Method Details

    • setServer

      public void setServer​(T server)
      Sets the current server to the one given.
      Parameters:
      server - a server to bind

    • getServer

      public T getServer()
      Gets the currently held object. Since this class is mainly for game servers, the name of this method is for understandability.
      Returns:
      the currently held game server (or whatever generic you have), or null if one doesn't exist

    • command

      public utils.servlet.HttpStatus command​(java.lang.String command, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, org.json.simple.JSONObject output)
      Responsible for parsing the given command and request and filling the given JSON object with values that make sense for the application. Implementations that defined this class will inherently have their implementations called when their associating servers are being pinged for a command.
      Parameters:
      command - the command keyword of meaning
      request - a request object containing possible user parameters
      response - add information to the response through a JSON object format to be used by the receiver.
      Returns:
      an http status code that signals to the client about the status of the request and response

    • getCommands

      public abstract java.util.List<Command> getCommands()
      Gets all the commands of this command handler. It is recommended to call the base class (if one exists) to get a full list of commands that are supported by this handler.
      Returns:
      a list of supported commands
